relation: Life in the World (Twelve Swords Supplement)
One Person Party (3.5e Optimized Character Build)
Campaign setting deleted; check these to see if they are suitable for general D20M material (removing breadcrumb/category if kept)
Campaign was deleted; go through these and put anything complete & usable into general lists; delete the rest.

Several things are using this: Unrelated Class maneuvers (Martial Artist, Monk; these don't seem to use unified mechanics. Martial Artist maneuvers are scaled 1st to 5th level, Monks 1st to 9th level) and a group of Feats. Each needs it's own category and the page IDs need correcting.

Blanket deletion proposal for all these. I can't find the system that makes these work. They are non-PC creatures, but gain experience? They have high CRs but deal just 1d3 or 1d6 damage? Doesn't explain anywhere what the "PokeMoves" are. They have special rules for dealingnon-lethal damage against pokemon, but that's inherent to the campaign world (it's a kids cartoon), not the pokemon themselves.
exactly same information as Steelhive Humans (D20 Modern Race) page
These can go now, abandoned campaign deleted
Stubbed for 5 years, no actual adventure is here
Has had no content for 6 years
Has had no content for 8 years

Appears to be part of some variant rules not present on the wiki. If it only deals a single 1d3 damage attack, why is it CR 2? How it able to gain experience if it's a creature, not a PC? What are the PokeMoves?
No content to guide actual character creation for this campaign. Untouched in 7 years.
Messed up. Recreated, improved, and renamed as Elemental Mage
Neither the description nor the traits are very good, no attempt has been made to improve this since tagged last January

This is a blanket deletion proposal for all the feats in this series. They are unusably bad. You don't multiply ability score modifiers, they have a linear progression. The special attack is nonsense. Gate 2. Gate of Healing literally makes no sense. This template has been repeatedly removed by IPs in the past, so unfortunately I will need to protect the page, take the discussion to the talk page.
No description. The map has no context (but I guess I know where the mountains are...)

Take an elf, then add some traits that simply don't work, and mess up the attack lines. It would be simpler and more mechanically sound for the DM to take a stock elf and give them the spells flame blade and produce flame.
Has been "terribly incomplete" for 6 years. We don't know anything about this race apart from their depressing bonuses.
Giving this two weeks for some content.
5 years since needsbalance template added, no attempt at improving this has been made
No content apart from the most generic of description.
BAB/grapple is wrong, has no speed or intelligence, attack is incomplete, magic resistance is not explained (is it spell resistance? What's the value? Needs rewriting from scratch basically.
Writing is pretty bad, and without any dogma, it's unclear what followers of this deity are supposed to do.
This is basically a Mary Sue class
title: Articles with delete templates

Recent Deletions[edit] The fair use of a copyrighted work, including such use by reproduction in copies or phonorecords or by any other means specified by that section, for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching (including multiple copies for classroom use), scholarship, or research, is not an infringement of copyright. All other types are an infringement of product copyright, and those images are to be queued for image deletion. Images which the author's lifespan is shorter then what is stated by Public Domain. On Public Domain images you don't have to say anything, as it defaults to the GNU Free Documentation License v1.3. Different licenses that do not allow for reproductive work. Please state which other license, if any, the image falls under. An image without a licensing statement is considered to be under the GNU Free Documentation License v1.3. Attribute the author; if it's a reproductive license we have to release it under the same license (and these images are not to be queued for deletion). If its an image the uploaded created himself then its up to them what information they provide. Copyright images. We cannot use these without permission. If we can get permission, the owner would normally ask us to attribute them and show that it's under copyright. We can use copyright work
